short_summary: The tender solicits a proposal that must be selected \\
full_summary:
**Government Contract Opportunity**

**Contract Short Title**: 
 Local Access Service Quebec-Remote Regions

**Government Agency**
 Shared Services Canada
 90 Metcalfe Street
 Ottawa, ON K0A 0C3

**Contract Type**
Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN) - Open bidding

**Notice Type**
Open call to suppliers to submit a statement of capabilities.

**Procurement Description:**
 Shared Services Canada (SSC) requires a contractor to provide local access services to its offices located in remote regions of Quebec, including Rimouski, Sept-Iles, Matane, and Gaspe.

**Services Description:**
The contractor will be required to provide local access services using wireless and Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) solutions. The service must ensure that directory numbers for existing lines remain unchanged and that the supplier does not use the client's data local access network (LAN).

**Contract Requirements:**
The contractor must have a minimum of 10 years of experience in delivering complex local access services, at least 5 years of experience in delivering local access services in the given geographic area, and at least 5 years of experience in supporting 50% of the volume of total local access lines across the applicable region.

**Submission Requirements:**
Interested suppliers must submit a statement of capabilities in writing to [Jean-Charles St-Onge ( Jean-Charles.St-Onge@ssc-spc.gc.ca) ] by December 27, 2022, at 14:00 EST.

**Notice Information:**
This ACAN is issued under the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA). The contract will be awarded to the pre-selected supplier unless a more qualified supplier submits a statement of capabilities.

**Closing Date and Time:**
December 27, 2022, at 14:00 EST.

**Contact Information:**
Jean-Charles St-Onge 
 Phone: (613) 618-0167 
 Email: Jean-Charles.St-Onge@ssc-spc.gc.ca
 

Note:
* The bidder announcement will no longer be open for submissions.
* The contract details are available on request. 
* The entries that indicate a date have been updated in “MM/DD/YYYY” format.
* A token has been added to make the entries safe for publication.
* Header entries identify a corresponding reference for easier searching and used as reference in exported spreadsheets.
* Entries relate to a specific category of functionality covered †·.† An illustration of full form of {'NOT NOT Those references are not with' Clause}. Only about
